00138 extern verifier4    NFS4_write_verifier ; /* NFS V4 write verifier from nfs_Main.c     */
00139 
00140 #define arg_WRITE4 op->nfs_argop4_u.opwrite
00141 #define res_WRITE4 resp->nfs_resop4_u.opwrite
00142 
00143 int nfs4_op_write(  struct nfs_argop4 * op ,   
00144                      compound_data_t   * data,
00145                      struct nfs_resop4 * resp)
00146 {
00147   char funcname[] = "nfs4_op_write" ;
00148   
00149   fsal_seek_t            seek_descriptor ;
00150   fsal_size_t            size ;
00151   fsal_size_t            written_size;
00152   fsal_off_t             offset ;
00153   fsal_boolean_t         eof_met ;
00154         caddr_t                bufferdata ;
00155   stable_how4            stable_how ;
00156   cache_content_status_t content_status ;
00157   cache_inode_status_t   cache_status ;
00158   fsal_attrib_list_t     attr ;
00159   cache_entry_t        * entry = NULL ;
00160 
00161   cache_content_policy_data_t datapol ;
00162 
00163   datapol.UseMaxCacheSize = FALSE ;
00164  
00165  
00166   /* Lock are not supported */
00167   resp->resop = NFS4_OP_WRITE ;
00168   res_WRITE4.status =  NFS4_OK ;
00169   
00170   /* If there is no FH */
00171     if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Empty( &(data->currentFH  ) ) )
00172       {
00173         res_WRITE4.status = NFS4ERR_NOFILEHANDLE ;
00174         return  res_WRITE4.status ;
00175       }
00176   
00177     /* If the filehandle is invalid */
00178     if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Invalid( &(data->currentFH ) ) )
00179       {
00180         res_WRITE4.status = NFS4ERR_BADHANDLE ;
00181         return res_WRITE4.status ;
00182       }
00183     
00184     /* Tests if the Filehandle is expired (for volatile filehandle) */
00185     if( nfs4_Is_Fh_Expired( &(data->currentFH) ) )
00186       {
00187         res_WRITE4.status = NFS4ERR_FHEXPIRED ;
00188         return res_WRITE4.status ;
00189       }
00190   
00191     /* vnode to manage is the current one */
00192     entry = data->current_entry ;
00193 
00194     /* Only files can be written */
00195     if( data->current_filetype != REGULAR_FILE )
00196       {
00197         /* If the destination is no file, return EISDIR if it is a directory and EINAVL otherwise */
00198         if( data->current_filetype == DIR_BEGINNING || data->current_filetype == DIR_CONTINUE  )
00199           res_WRITE4.status = NFS4ERR_ISDIR ;
00200         else
00201           res_WRITE4.status = NFS4ERR_INVAL ;
00202         
00203         return res_WRITE4.status ;
00204       }
00205 
00206     
00207     /* Get the characteristics of the I/O to be made */
00208     offset     = arg_WRITE4.offset ;
00209     size       = arg_WRITE4.data.data_len ;
00210     stable_how = arg_WRITE4.stable ;
00211 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4    
00212     printf( "   NFS4_OP_WRITE: offset = %llu  length = %llu   stable = %d\n", offset, size, stable_how ) ;
00213 #endif
00214 
00215     if( ( data->pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_MAXOFFSETWRITE ) == EXPORT_OPTION_MAXOFFSETWRITE )
00216      if( (fsal_off_t)(offset+size) > data->pexport->MaxOffsetWrite ) 
00217       {
00218          res_WRITE4.status = NFS4ERR_DQUOT ;
00219          return res_WRITE4.status ;
00220       }
00221 
00222   
00223     /* The size to be written should not be greater than FATTR4_MAXWRITESIZE because this value is asked 
00224      * by the client at mount time, but we check this by security */
00225     if(  ( data->pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_MAXWRITE == EXPORT_OPTION_MAXWRITE ) &&
00226          size > data->pexport->MaxWrite )
00227       {
00228                                 /*
00229                                  * The client asked for too much data, we
00230                                  * must restrict him 
00231                                  */
00232                                 size = data->pexport->MaxWrite ;
00233                         }
00234     
00235     /* Where are the data ? */
00236     bufferdata = arg_WRITE4.data.data_val ;
00237     
00238 #ifdef _DEBUG_NFS_V4
00239         printf( "             NFS4_OP_WRITE: offset = %llu  length = %llu\n", offset, size ) ;
00240 #endif
00241 
00242   /* if size == 0 , no I/O) are actually made and everything is alright */
00243   if( size == 0 )
00244     {
00245       res_WRITE4.WRITE4res_u.resok4.count = 0 ;
00246       res_WRITE4.WRITE4res_u.resok4.committed = FILE_SYNC4 ;
00247 
00248       memcpy( res_WRITE4.WRITE4res_u.resok4.writeverf, NFS4_write_verifier, sizeof(verifier4) );
00249       
00250       res_WRITE4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00251       return  res_WRITE4.status ;
00252     }
00253 
00254   /* Deny write access to share write denied file */
00255   if( entry->object.file.pshare != NULL )
00257    if( memcmp( entry->object.file.pshare->stateid_other, arg_WRITE4.stateid.other, 12 ) &&
00258        ( entry->object.file.pshare->data.share.share_deny & OPEN4_SHARE_DENY_WRITE  ) )
00259     {
00260       res_WRITE4.status = NFS4ERR_LOCKED ;
00261       return res_WRITE4.status ;
00262     }
00263 
00264   if( ( data->pexport->options &  EXPORT_OPTION_USE_DATACACHE ) &&
00265       ( cache_content_cache_behaviour( entry, 
00266                                        &datapol,
00267                                        (cache_content_client_t *)(data->pclient->pcontent_client), 
00268                                        &content_status ) == CACHE_CONTENT_FULLY_CACHED ) &&
00269       ( entry->object.file.pentry_content == NULL ) )
00270     {
00271       /* Entry is not in datacache, but should be in, cache it .
00272        * Several threads may call this function at the first time and a race condition can occur here
00273        * in order to avoid this, cache_inode_add_data_cache is "mutex protected" 
00274        * The first call will create the file content cache entry, the further will return
00275        * with error CACHE_INODE_CACHE_CONTENT_EXISTS which is not a pathological thing here */
00276       
00277       datapol.UseMaxCacheSize = data->pexport->options & EXPORT_OPTION_MAXCACHESIZE ;
00278       datapol.MaxCacheSize = data->pexport->MaxCacheSize ;
00279 
00280       /* Status is set in last argument */
00281       cache_inode_add_data_cache( entry, data->ht, data->pclient, data->pcontext, &cache_status ) ;
00282 
00283       if( ( cache_status != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS ) && 
00284           ( cache_status != CACHE_INODE_CACHE_CONTENT_EXISTS ) )
00285         {
00286           res_WRITE4.status = NFS4ERR_SERVERFAULT ;
00287           return res_WRITE4.status ;
00288         }
00289 
00290     }
00291   
00292   /* An actual write is to be made, prepare it */
00293   /* only FILE_SYNC mode is supported */
00294   /* Set up uio to define the transfer */
00295   seek_descriptor.whence = FSAL_SEEK_SET ;
00296   seek_descriptor.offset = offset ;
00297   
00298   if( cache_inode_rdwr( entry, 
00299                         CACHE_CONTENT_WRITE, 
00300                         &seek_descriptor,
00301                         size,
00302                         &written_size,
00303                         &attr,
00304                         bufferdata, 
00305                         &eof_met,
00306                         data->ht, 
00307                         data->pclient, 
00308                         data->pcontext, 
00309                         &cache_status )  != CACHE_INODE_SUCCESS )
00310     {
00311       res_WRITE4.status = nfs4_Errno( cache_status ) ;
00312       return res_WRITE4.status ;
00313     }
00314   
00315   
00316   
00317   /* Set the returned value */
00318   res_WRITE4.WRITE4res_u.resok4.count = written_size ;
00319   res_WRITE4.WRITE4res_u.resok4.committed = FILE_SYNC4 ;
00320   memcpy( res_WRITE4.WRITE4res_u.resok4.writeverf, NFS4_write_verifier, sizeof(verifier4) );
00321   
00322   
00323   res_WRITE4.status = NFS4_OK ;
00324   
00325   return res_WRITE4.status;
00326 } /* nfs4_op_write */
00327 
00328     
00339 void nfs4_op_write_Free( WRITE4res * resp )
00340 {
00341   /* Nothing to be done */
00342   return ;
00343 } /* nfs4_op_write_Free */
